body_html: It sounds like the two docker containers aren't reachable from one another. Can you verify that if you start a tf.train.Server in one container, you can connect to it (create a tf.Session(server_target) where server_target is the address you expect the server to have) in the other?
body_text: It sounds like the two docker containers aren't reachable from one another. Can you verify that if you start a  tf.train.Server in one container, you can connect to it (create a tf.Session(server_target) where server_target is the address you expect the server to have) in the other?
body: It sounds like the two docker containers aren't reachable from one another. Can you verify that if you start a  `tf.train.Server` in one container, you can connect to it (create a `tf.Session(server_target)` where `server_target` is the address you expect the server to have) in the other?
